p: The highest total phenol content was found from D. peninervium (0.43 mg of GAE/g extract) followed by O. integrifolia (0.39 mg of GAE/g extract) as indicated in Table 4 and Figure 3 A. Similarly, the highest amount of flavonoids was measured with D. peninervium (0.38 mg of QE/g extract) while F. communis and O. integrifolia contained comparable amounts of flavonoids, 0.2 and 0.18 mg of QE/g extract respectively as depicted in Table 4 and Figure 3B.
